summary: The 'Ensuring Airline Resiliency to Reduce Delays and Cancellations Act' directs the Secretary of Transportation to require air carriers to create and regularly update operational resiliency strategies. These strategies must detail how carriers plan to mitigate the impacts of severe weather, disruptive events, staffing issues, cybersecurity risks, and other operational challenges. The Comptroller General will audit the effectiveness of these strategies within three years and report to Congress. The bill aims to protect consumers and maintain airline operational stability, focusing on proactive measures to minimize disruptions.
